alert.note: Alert for Eagle (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 03 at 1:57PM MDT until November 03 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Eagle County in west central Colorado... * Until 300 PM MDT. * At 157 PM MDT, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Avon to Minturn to near Redcliff, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 170 and 190. Locations impacted include... Avon, Vail, Minturn, Vail Pass, Redcliff, Red Cliff, Gilman, Dowd and Eagle-Vail. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
